conclusion: Analyze the behavior of light beams through the hemispherical glass brick.
Angles of incidence are 0°, so angles of refraction are also 0°, indicating straight-line travel through glass.
Path lengths r1 and r2 are different, affecting travel time through glass.
Frequency relates to wavelength by c = λf, and speed of light in glass is v = c/n.
Wavelength in glass is inversely proportional to refractive index; longer wavelength means lower frequency.
Light b has lower frequency and longer wavelength, making it more likely to exhibit diffraction.
Final answer: Light b is more likely to exhibit diffraction than light a.
